dublinCore.dc:title: 119 S947 IS: United States Citrus Protection Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Scott of Florida introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To prohibit importation of commercially produced fresh citrus fruit originating from the People’s Republic of China.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the United States Citrus Protection Act.

section.header: Prohibition on importation of commercially produced fresh citrus fruit originating from the People’s Republic of China

subsection.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, articles of commercially produced fresh citrus fruit originating from the People’s Republic of China may not be imported into the United States.
This Act shall take effect on the date that is 90 days after the date of the enactment of this Act.
